channel.title: Magic page
channel.description: How do I make it so that the teleports are always highlighted? There is no rune requirement for them right now, yet it still shows them as "needing" them. Thanks.

item.title: Magic page

Found it. thanks.

item.title: Magic page
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

[quote=“livingpro, post:5, topic:537884”]Thanks a lot guys, this is my first time doing stuff with the cache.
I found everything I was looking for.
There is one other problem though, when i try loading my interfaces with Lin’s interface editor, it only loads up one interface. Why is this?[/quote]
Because you have to change interface id’s in one of the drop downs.

Read full topic

item.title: Magic page
item.dc:creator: @Togasa Togasa
item.description:
@Togasa wrote:

It’s a lot easier to do it over TV or Skype and show you step by step… but it takes less than 5 min… you wanna export all the teleport sprites that are highlighted and import them into the media files of the magic icons that aren’t highlighted.

Read full topic

item.title: Magic page
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

[quote=“livingpro, post:1, topic:537884”]How do I make it so that the teleports are always highlighted?
There is no rune requirement for them right now, yet it still shows them as “needing” them.
Thanks.[/quote]
Like Togasa said.

Use toms cache editor to load up your cache and open the media archive (I believe) and then you’d want to extract the lit sprites out of the cache (idk what they are named so gl getting that because you need it) and then save it. Then you go to the unlit ones and just import the lit ones over it. If you give the wrong name your cache won’t load properly anymore.

Read full topic

Thanks.[/quote]
Use Tom’s Cache Suite and edit it through there…
I could be more specific but atm I’m too busy to spoonfeed… jus thought I’d respond since no one else did.

Read full topic
